page.title: 10AGRICULTURE 3 DOWNDERRY
page.content: (3)TREYONE.400 acres.Tenanted.Recently {(1978)}four farms have amalgamated.Now intensive and specialized.180 acres support 800 shortwool ewes providing good quality fleece (at Â£3.50 ) plus annual market of 100 sheep and 1200 lamb.220 acres in winter and spring corn yielding 35 cwt.per acre.Recent hedgerow removal has doubled field size to average 10 acres. Mechanised procedures enables the two man labour force to cope with this,locally large,acreage.Shearing is by contract labour.The fertilizer input of up to 5 cwt per acre(av.2.5 cwt).Other inputs include grain drying and feed. Ancient woodland is retained by Bake Estate. This is 30 acres of unmanaged,even aged,oak wood on steep slopes. Surplus buildings are used for the Treyone woodworking factory,making speaker cabinets and quality kitchens.
